TopicTitle: How Many Parts Before YOU Lag?

Articles.Content:
Well, the first thing I did when 0.20 came out was check if my station still runs like a dead turtle.

Turns out it does.

Anyway, with the new Kerbal Knowledge Base (Awesome, BTW!), I was able to find out that this station is only 334 parts... yet unplayable for me.

I would like to know how large your stations are before they begin lagging, because I personally would like to know JUST how bad my computer is.

Please don't take this as complaining about the patch, really, I'm not. Don't get me wrong, there is a definite improvement, however my station is just too much for my CPU to handle.
600 to 700 with out getting to many CPU farts

I am currently running a computer built and maintained by the brightest scientific minds of all Kerbal kind. I will now answer your question based on the data I have available to me at this time.

My FPS drops when I load this many parts:

Short answer- 1.0

Long answer - One point zero
Since .20, I'm up around 750(ish) before I get annoyed
for me about 100 for space planes and 200 for rockets, for some reason the type of vehicle makes a difference.
Haven't messed with .20 yet, but back before the patch I would be around 450 at max settings before my rocket launches started sounding like the old Transformers sound.
250-300 parts before the timer turns yellow. I'm have pretty much all the setting on max.
~400 parts get's me the timer on yellow. using an i5-2500k 8gb ram and SLI gtx460 and all settings maxed except fallback.
I don't lag...i-5-2500k, 16GB Ram, Radeon 7550 2GB. Full settings.
Wait, the color of the timer indicates how well the game is running?
About 350 on minimim graphics, 300 on medium. I have an i-5 8gb RAM laptop.

Wait, the color of the timer indicates how well the game is running?

I believe so. Green is good, yellow is laggy.
200 for me.
2, and the lag makes the game unplayable. Luckily, this saturday, the ram for my new computer comes in, and I will be able to play at max.
My Soyuz replica has 345 parts, and it turns the timer yellow and causes significant slowdowns. However, I still consider the game playable and it's not a horrible framerate in my eyes.

I always get a tad bit of lag around 50 FPS because I can't live without 6 chrome tabs minecraft steam skype fraps hamachi and inevitably a few folders running in the background. I start getting unusual lag around 600-750 parts but im sure i could double that if i closed most of my stuff.
Before the patch, about 300 plus, and since I have started with 0.20, about 10 parts. I have no clue why, I've checked all my processes, and I've lowered my settings to minimal, but it's terrible.
I've never built something supermassive but at 250ish parts my 'puter is still twiddling its thumbs and not batting an eyelash. Gfx are maxed. Maybe I should try someone else's crazy build

about 100-150

Was this. Seems worse though sadly. Now about 50-100. :/

Might have a look at my overclock of running programs. But it might be some changes in 0.20.

I'm chuffed though, as my mega project comes in at 150 parts.

1 part: 15 fps. 200 parts: 15 fps.

Wut?

I run full graphics and can manage up to about 800 parts in space before it gets annoying. I have flown something with 986 parts called "The Jellyfish" from launch that my brother came up with. Amazingly it works but at that point I'm doing something like 2-4 fps.

At launch my comfort limit seems to be about 500 parts.

I believe so. Green is good, yellow is laggy.

What's this timer we're talking about?

What's this timer we're talking about?

It's the MET (Mission Elapsed Time), below the timewarp.
300 parts is lagging a bit. But i can still play well over 400 or so.
